text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/eb26f4331f607b1639bf01f4f35ad3ce7d20cb10|patch 8.2.1680: Vim9: line number for compare error is wrong>
patch 8.2.1680: Vim9: line number for compare error is wrong

Problem:    Vim9: line number for compare error is wrong.
Solution:   Set SOURCING_LNUM. (closes #6936)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1680: Vim9: line number for compare error is wrong · vim/vim@eb26f43
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1680: Vim9: line number for compare error is wrong · vim/vim@eb26f43
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: line number for compare error is wrong. Solution: Set SOURCING_LNUM. (closes #6936)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3bd8de40b484d3617a19092d3cc036f8b4f3d51c|patch 8.2.1679: Vim9: ":*" is not recognized as a range>
patch 8.2.1679: Vim9: ":*" is not recognized as a range

Problem:    Vim9: ":*" is not recognized as a range.
Solution:   Move recognizing "*" into skip_range(). (closes #6838)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1679: Vim9: ":*" is not recognized as a range · vim/vim@3bd8de4
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1679: Vim9: ":*" is not recognized as a range · vim/vim@3bd8de4
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: ":*" is not recognized as a range. Solution: Move recognizing "*" into skip_range(). (closes #6838)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/d1f76afaf963be706697279ab0570ffcb8a1f2fc|patch 8.2.1678: crash when using ":set" after ":ownsyntax">
patch 8.2.1678: crash when using ":set" after ":ownsyntax"

Problem:    Crash when using ":set" after ":ownsyntax".
Solution:   Make sure 'spelloptions' is not NULL. (closes #6950)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1678: crash when using ":set" after ":ownsyntax" · vim/vim@d1f76af
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1678: crash when using ":set" after ":ownsyntax" · vim/vim@d1f76af
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when using ":set" after ":ownsyntax". Solution: Make sure 'spelloptions' is not NULL. (closes #6950)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4d170af0a9379da64d67dc3fa7cc7297956c6f52|patch 8.2.1677: memory access errors when calling setloclist() in aut…>
patch 8.2.1677: memory access errors when calling setloclist() in autocommand

Problem:    Memory access errors when calling setloclist() in an autocommand.
Solution:   Give an error if the list was changed unexpectedly. (closes #6946)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1677: memory access errors when calling setloclist() in aut… · vim/vim@4d170af
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1677: memory access errors when calling setloclist() in aut… · vim/vim@4d170af
attachments.text: …ocommand Problem: Memory access errors when calling setloclist() in an autocommand. Solution: Give an error if the list was changed unexpectedly. (closes #6946)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/a4224860a498eb870280130e00fe6f376b7a2e6b|patch 8.2.1676: compiler warnings for function typecast>
patch 8.2.1676: compiler warnings for function typecast

Problem:    Compiler warnings for function typecast.
Solution:   Add an intermediate cast to "void *".

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1676: compiler warnings for function typecast · vim/vim@a422486
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1676: compiler warnings for function typecast · vim/vim@a422486
attachments.text: Problem: Compiler warnings for function typecast. Solution: Add an intermediate cast to "void *".

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/05c1acd5e1564ea4dbc7d4be26908af6909f43f6|patch 8.2.1675: MinGW: testdir makefile deletes non-existing file>
patch 8.2.1675: MinGW: testdir makefile deletes non-existing file

Problem:    MinGW: testdir makefile deletes non-existing file.
Solution:   Use another way to delete the output file if it already exists.
            (Michael Soyka)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1675: MinGW: testdir makefile deletes non-existing file · vim/vim@05c1acd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1675: MinGW: testdir makefile deletes non-existing file · vim/vim@05c1acd
attachments.text: Problem: MinGW: testdir makefile deletes non-existing file. Solution: Use another way to delete the output file if it already exists. (Michael Soyka)

patch 8.2.1674: Vim9: internal error when using variable that was not set

Problem:    Vim9: internal error when using variable that was not set.
Solution:   Give a meaningful error. (closes #6937)
